oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Steers on Gay Street
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Thompson Brothers
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Two large steers draw a crowd on Gay Street, Knoxville, TN, in 1877. Fouche Block building at left (Gay Street &Clinch Avenue). Possibly the prize-winning steer of Perez Dickinson.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Events; Cattle;
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: To use photographs or to order reproductions, contact DigitalCollections@knoxlib.org or phone 865 215-8808. Please refer to Image Number and provide a brief description of the photograph.
